utterance.content: Measuring drapes already, Mr. Reed?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Like it or not, Detective, the network wants me to take over Bobby's time slot next week right after the tribute. I know it seems callous, but it's what Bobby would've wanted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even over his dead body.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did you lie to us about seeing Mann the other night?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Ay. Look, I'm sorry, but I lied because I didn't want it getting out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That you two were fighting?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: It's hard enough filling the man's shoes around here. I don't need the tabloids writing out us getting into it on the night he died. So I lied. So what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you lied to a cop.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Let's be realistic. The guy died from a heart attack, right? What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was a heart attack that was a result of toxins in his system, toxins that he ingested somewhere around the time that you saw him.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: So you guys are saying I killed Bobby? Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it's no secret, you were supposed to get his 11:30 slot, but Bobby extended his contract. Maybe you couldn't wait.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: You sound as demented as Bobby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Last time I saw him, we're best of pals, right? The other night he comes over, he's ranting and raving, talking about what a disloyal punk I've been.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Man, I don't know. All he kept saying was, he knew things. And I'm like, "Bobby, what are you talking about?" He storms out saying I knew what I'd done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C.S.U.'s at Mickey's apartment running a sweep for our toxin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Killing the king of late-night to take his throne-- It's very Richard III. It appeals to the writer in me. Did you want a bite of this?

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: Hell, I'll sic God on you! And you? I don't ever want to see you on my network again. You're banned! And you?! I don't know you. You're all a bunch of nobodies! I could buy this precinct!

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Howard Weisberg, president of the network. He just found out about the search warrant for Mickey Reed. And he also found out that we think Bobby Mann was murdered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Breaking news on a different network. The guy got scooped on his own star's murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So much for keeping the press out.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You two better be right about all this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Text giggling? Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's Alexis. She just saw a loon feeding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Funny. So did I.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So... Mann's Bugatti is still in the garage. They won't let us touch it without a search warrant.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: $2-million car. Apparently, it's worth more than their insurance policy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re sure they aren't joyriding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, check with the judge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If his car is still in the garage, where'd he go after Mickey's place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it couldn't have been very far. Hey, Ryan. Did Mickey's doorman mention in what direction Mann was headed when he left?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh...

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: South.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: South.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: South on Broadway from 57th. That's the theater district.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At 2:00 in the morning? There's nothing playing then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there's diners, there's clubs, there's restaurants.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, other than the poison and the gum, we know he didn't eat or drink anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe "tory" is a place he went. Uh, conservatory, inventory, purgatory—

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Factory! The Comic Factory. Mann was a comedian. He went to a comedy club.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Comic Factory is on, uh, 55th and Broadway. That's two blocks South. He put his gum in a-- in a piece of paper from a comic factory flyer. You're right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then from the forensics, we know he didn't have the cranberry or the balsamic before he spit it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he was poisoned either at or after the club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then Mickey Reed didn't kill Bobby. He's not our guy. Hey, guys. How do you feel about going to see a little comedy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy's got the most recognizable face in comedy.

utterance.speaker: OWNER OF THE CLUB
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Look, I got a call on the club phone. The caller I.D.'s from Bobby's show. A guy asks about one of my comedians. Couple hours later, guy shows up to see that comedian, but he's got a funny looking moustache and he's wearing a baseball cap. It looked like Bobby.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did he talk to anyone? Did he have a drink?

utterance.speaker: OWNER
utterance.content: No. He sat in the back, left his drink ticket, and bolted out the side after watching the comedian he came to see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anything special about this particular comedian?

utterance.speaker: OWNER
utterance.content: Angel Santana, the proverbial rising star? I'm assuming you know about the incident that night?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What incident?

utterance.speaker: ANGEL
utterance.content: I'm Angel Santana. Good night, y'all.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Santana. I'm Detective Esposito. This is Detective Ryan.

utterance.speaker: ANGEL
utterance.content: Oh, hey. Thanks for coming. The officer I talked to did not instil a lot of confidence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You want to tell us about it?

utterance.speaker: ANGEL
utterance.content: Not much to tell. During my set that night, someone smashed my bike's taillight, banged up the fenders and scratched "late-night *****" into the tank. I mean, what does that even mean?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, we're not here about your bike.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ms. Santana, did you know Bobby Mann?

utterance.speaker: ANGEL
utterance.content: You mean personally? No. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, because he came to see your act on the night he was killed. Any idea why?

utterance.speaker: ANGEL
utterance.content: Wow. He probably trashed my bike. I've heard stories about him. I know guys he's blackballed just because they did his competitors' show.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is there any reason why he might have wanted to come after you?

utterance.speaker: ANGEL
utterance.content: His producer tried to book me on his show last month, but Mickey Reed wanted me, too. I had to pick. Mickey felt more like my vibe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Club owner said Bobby left at 2:30, and the bartender confirms he didn't drink anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which leaves us... Two hours left to account for and a whole lot of strange behaviour. Why would Bobby go see a comedian who didn't want to do his show and then bust up her bike?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Aren't famous people crazy and narcissistic?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't know. Gotta ask Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where is Castle anyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm gonna need some new shirts.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: No shirts.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's okay, Castle. You don't have to pretend to not be in a good mood for my sake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why should I be in a good mood? I mean... I'm a writer. We... famously brood. We... I should brood more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to brood? Forensics on Angel Santana's motorcycle are a bust. There's no fingerprints. Nothing. We have no idea where Mann was after 2:30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about his car?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan and Esposito got a warrant this morning. But seeing that he was poisoned after he parked it, chances are we won't find anything. And his financials were clear. He pays more in alimony in a day than I make in an entire year. There's no red flags on his phone records. And I reinterviewed all of his colleagues. No one has any idea why he was acting so paranoid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're not paranoid if someone's actually trying to kill you. Hey, Tony! How's my favourite movie mogul? Yes. Right? She'd be perfect for Nikki. Yes. Perfect. Thank you. That's a Heat Wave producer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That wasn't about Ellie Monroe, was it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's why she was throwing herself at you. She wanted you to recommend her for the part.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, and for the record, she's nothing like Nikki Heat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you just can't stand it that a beautiful actress is actually interested in me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would I care?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. That's a good question. Why would you care?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. I'm gonna go get some coffee.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. I've got work to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Break room's that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Desk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett. Castle. Check this out. We just finished the sweep of Bobby's car. First off, the Bugatti-- holy shift. When you start this thing, you can feel it right in—

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But as exciting as the car is, I think we figured out why Bobby Mann was so tweaked. We found this in his glove compartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's Kayla. She's an intern at Bobby's show.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like she was doing more than interning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You should check out the back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "If they find out, you're dead." Blackmail, death threats and scandal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains why his behaviour was so erratic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And probably why he was killed.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: It was last week. I stayed late to help Bobby with some bits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any idea who took that, Kayla?

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Must be someone who works on the show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who just happened to have a camera and managed to catch the two of you in the act? Or were they tipped off maybe? Were you blackmailing Bobby?

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Oh, my God. No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He's three times your age, and you are an intern on the show. That adds up to embarrassment and scandal, which I'm sure he'd pay a lot to avoid.

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: No, I would never do that. We were in love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In love? Really? And... how long were the two of you together?

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Three weeks this past Monday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um... Who else knew?

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: No one. Bobby and I kept it a secret. We didn't want my mom to find out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your mom?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who's your mom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He's already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Marks, we just--

utterance.speaker: KAYLA
utterance.content: Mom, you don't understand--

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: You realize, if this gets out, it'll destroy Bobby's reputation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We're not trying to add to an already difficult situation. We're just trying to find the killer.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Bobby wasn't an angel, but you look at the man in his entirety. He deserves to be remembered with grace. This business gets clouded by money, fame, ambition. The only thing that Bobby really cared about was making people laugh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whoever took this either works for this show or had access to this building. And maybe it was someone in a financial jam who was looking to score a quick buck. Or maybe it's someone with a grudge against Bobby.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I can't imagine anyone doing that. He was a great boss. Everyone loved him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, and apparently, he loved them back.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Okay. Uh, Janine can get you a list of everyone on the crew once she's done yelling at Kayla. Poor kid. Who knows? She might have ended up being number seven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What have we got?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, once we suspected blackmail, I ran through his financials again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought they were clean.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, they were, but going back, we found this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He spent 100 grand on a kitchen reno.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Totally legitimate, but we searched his brownstone—

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And he wasn't renovating his kitchen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who was on the receiving end of the 100 grand?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Zach Robinson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Good bad-guy name. Snakey "z," hard "k." even has "rob" in it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good bad-guy rap sheet, too. Former lowlife private investigator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I remember this guy. He had some celebrity clients back in the day. He was known for digging up dirt on folks and turning it into a personal payday.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He did a nickel on multiple counts of extortion, wire tapping, racketeering and blackmail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Robinson must have gotten the picture from somebody on the inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. Figured it was worth a fast buck. But if Bobby paid, why would he kill him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bobby figured out that Robinson was a blackmailer, and then he threatened to take him to the cops.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bobby pushes, Robinson pushes back harder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let's go pick him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Easier said than done. Esposito already ran down his last known address. Robinson's in the wind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, let's keep looking.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: You are a bad man, Zach Robinson. A dirty, naughty, no-good blackmailer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you do all your interrogations in bed, Detective Heat?

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: You think this is funny, Robinson? Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, okay. No, I'll do whatever you want, Nikki.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Okay. That's more like it. Mm. You are so sweet. And brilliant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guilty.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Mm. What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. It's ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: What? Come on. Tell me. I want to know what goes on inside that incredible mind of yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, since you put it that way. I have this... friend at work who thinks that the only reason you're with me is, you know... for the part in the movie.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Wow. Really? What does this friend of yours base that on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? I'm-- I'm sorry. I shouldn't have repeated that.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Does this friend know me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Has he read anything about me that would make him think that I would prostitute myself for a role?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Of course not. You--I--he's an idiot.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Do you have any idea how hard it is to be a woman in Hollywood?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ellie. I— Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. He looks like a Zach Robinson. Where'd you find him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The boys caught up with him at a craps table at Mohegan Sun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Already gambling away his hard-earned blackmail money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how was your date with your little starlet?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell this time?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like I said, Castle... trained detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well... It went lovely, no thanks to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did I have to do with it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You pulled your Jedi mind trick on me. You made me doubt Ellie's honesty. Foolishly, I told her what you said, made her cry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle... She's an actress, a professional liar. She's paid to cry on cue.

utterance.speaker: ZACH ROBINSON
utterance.content: No. I've never seen this picture before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? You sure you didn't use it to blackmail Bobby Mann?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Blackmail? You're fishing in the wrong pond, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the 100 grand from Bobby Mann in your bank account? Am I in the right pond now?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: That was for... services rendered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't think Webster's defines "blackmailing" as a service. More like a coercive threat, Mr. Rob-inson.

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: No, no. No, no. I never threatened Bobby. He hired me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To do what? My guys say that you don't have an alibi for the night that Mann was murdered.

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: You can't be serious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I guess it'll come out when we go to the murder trial.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have a nice life... sentence.

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: What? No, no. No, no. No, no, no, no, no, no. Look, he reached out to me. Said he needed some work done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of work?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: The kind that you get paid a lot extra to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Something illegal.

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: W-well... Okay, look, he thought that somebody was out to get him. He said he needed to know, and so he paid me to bug a guy's office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Howard Weisberg.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The president of the network?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Easy gig, too. Bobby got me into the building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was this?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Week ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did you do with the recordings?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: I delivered the cds to Bobby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: You know... The morning before he died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bobby's producer said he locked himself in his office that morning. He was listening to the recordings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then they said he started acting paranoid after that, so what did he hear?

utterance.speaker: ZACH
utterance.content: Am I good to go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found the recordings in Mann's office mixed in with his DVD collection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Heard anything yet that would explain why Mann was listening in on his boss?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah, just a bunch of talk about setting up breakfasts, lunches, dinners and drinks with writers, actors and directors.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we on the blackmail?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, we got uniforms running down all show employees who could've had access to

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. You guys are gonna want to hear this.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: You know what? To hell with Bobby Mann. We're losing money on him every damn night. I want him out!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Our hands are tied.You can't fire him. He's got five years left on his contract.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: What if he drops dead, huh? Seriously. The guy has got a bad heart. How hard would it be to make him go away? I mean, hell, I got Mickey Reed telling me every day, he's ready to step in. If we could just get Bobby Mann out the damn door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, no wonder Bobby thought Mickey was disloyal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And no wonder he thought someone wanted him dead. Someone did.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: What if he drops dead, huh? Seriously. The guy has got a bad heart. How hard would it be to make him go away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like you got your wish, Mr. Weisberg.

utterance.speaker: LAWYER WEISBERG
utterance.content: Detective, none of the recordings are admissible in court.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: Oh, relax, Burt. I didn't kill anyone, okay? Save it for when I actually do. Detective, I wasn't serious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bobby thought you were.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: Well, then maybe he shouldn't have been bugging my office. Hell, in private, I issue a dozen death sentences a day on underperforming, overpaid jackasses at my network. Now what I wanted was Mickey Reed pulled to 11:30. But Bobby had an $80-million penalty on his contract.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which still had another five years left on it.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: Yeah. Now what I did was lean on Bobby for a few months to appeal to a younger audience. But the worst thing that I did was threaten to fire him and pay him the $80 mil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Weisberg where were you between 1:30 and 4:30 A.M. the night of the murder?

utterance.speaker: LAWYER
utterance.content: You don't have to answer that.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: It's fine, Burt. Chill out. I was at the Essex House Hotel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you with anyone?

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: As a matter of fact I was. This actress I was screwing wanted a part on one of my sitcoms. I met her after Bobby's show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm gonna need a name.

utterance.speaker: WEISBERG
utterance.content: Sure. Ellie Monroe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for coming by, Ms. Monroe.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Weisberg's alibi... Is good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, go on. You can say it. "I told you so."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, thanks. I'm actually not in the gloating mood. His alibi sets us back to square one... Which means we have no idea who the blackmailer is and we don't know why Mann went to the comedy club and trashed Angel Santana's bike. And we have no idea who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the good news is, I can work all night. No plans.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it's late, and I'm kinda tired. How about we pick this up in the morning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All righty, then. And the boys'll be back on duty tomorrow, to coin a phrase... Which would be inaccurate... because you are not a boy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is this some kind of a weird come-on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know what Bobby Mann was doing at that comedy club. I think I know why he thought he was an awful person. And... I think I know who killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. McPhee?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Ah. I was just going over my notes for the tribute. 35 years of friendship-- It's kinda hard to find just the right story to tell. What can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We just came by to give you this. Bobby's idea book-- we thought you might like it.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We did have a question about what he wrote on the last page.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: "The boys'll be back on duty tomorrow night."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, he crossed out "boys" and wrote "gang, posse" and "crew." Any idea why?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I guess we'll never know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wouldn't be too sure about that. The network was pressuring Bobby to make a change. They threatened to cancel him unless he did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the night that he was murdered, he told Barbara that something awful was going on. He asked her if he was a good person. Why would he say that?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Because of Kayla.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not Kayla, Hank. Because of you. He knew that he had to fire you. He knew he needed to find someone younger and hipper if he was gonna survive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone like Angel Santana. Weisberg confirmed that she was on the network's short list. That's why it wasn't "boys" anymore, Hank. 'cause Angel's a girl.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. Bobby would never fire me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did you kill him?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I didn't.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We ran your credit cards, Hank. The night that he was murdered, you went to a 24-hour grocery store and bought two things-- Cranberry juice and balsamic vinegar. It's time stamped. 1:56 A.M.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I'm betting if we test your keys, we'll find metal from Angel Santana's motorcycle where you scratched in "late-night *****."

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: He told me... that night just before he left the studio... how he'd heard Weisberg say they were gonna bury him unless he made a change. 35 years, I had his back. He was gonna toss me aside like one of his ex-wives, humiliate me in front of the whole country. I knew it was coming. I saw all the little signs, the awkward moments in the hall. I sent him that picture of him and Kayla to remind him of all the secrets I kept. You know what he said? The scandal would only help his ratings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You bought your poison and you followed him to the club.

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: I confronted him when he came out. I told him not to throw away everything we'd built. He told me he couldn't save me. Weisberg was going younger with or without him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you knew he didn't have a choice, why did you kill him?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: Because he did have another choice. Go down with the ship! We both go out gracefully, and Bobby gets 80 million bucks instead of him continuing the show with some kid. I gave him over 4,000 shows, laughing at every lousy joke he cracked, whether they were funny or not. Jeez.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So how did you manage it?

utterance.speaker: HANK
utterance.content: When I knew I couldn't change his mind, I told him... I understood. We walked over to the West Side highway, sat on a bench, looked out at the water, talked about what a great run we'd had. Then I offered him a drink. He was my best friend. You don't do that to your friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet another example of why you shouldn't mix business with pleasure, even show business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you talking about the case or yourself?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Touché, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you want to go for a victory lap and grab a burger?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, can't. Gotta go. Big date.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're kidding, right? You're going out with Ellie Monroe even though you know the only reason that she was interested in you was for a part? Have you lost all sense of human decency and self-res— What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My big date... is with Alexis. She's getting back from her trip.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right on time, Alexis. Oh, Sacagawea... has returned! And you are not Sacagawea, but come in.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Thanks. I'm headed back to L.A. and I just wanted to... say sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. But the truth is, I've never had so much fun being used. You feel free to have at me anytime.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Well, I guess you'll rescind your recommendation of me to your producers, and that is the least I deserve--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Tony thinks you are great for it, and so do I. You are a better actress than I thought when I recommended you.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Well, you should know, I wasn't acting the whole time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me neither.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Thanks, Rick. Take care.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You, too.

utterance.speaker: ELLIE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hi. Dad, was that--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My Sacagawea has returned! Oh, my God. My best girl. I missed you so much. Oh, my God. I'm so glad you're home.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I missed you, too, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're not just saying that, are you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, don't. Tell me you're hungry.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I'm starving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come with me. Tell me everything.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I will.
